sub_topic: Calculation of standard enthalpy change for a combustion reaction
message_1: What is the standard enthalpy change for the combustion reaction of one mole of methane gas (CH4) at standard temperature and pressure?
message_2: The standard enthalpy change for the combustion reaction of one mole of methane gas (CH4) at standard temperature and pressure is approximately -890 kJ/mol. This value represents the amount of heat released when one mole of methane is completely combusted in excess oxygen under standard conditions.
